timeline.bodyText: // Please add a comment why the instanceof check is not needed anymore
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText: Instead simplified the code further since no check at all is needed here.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Is it really that simple now? Why did we have so much more complicated before?
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText: It is. As for why it was so complicated before: I guess maybe in the past getParent of a StructuralElementInstance didnt give a SEI but an ICategoryAssignmentContainer. In that case, the old implementation makes sense because some type checking is needed. But since getParent gives a SEI, removing all the type checking logic gives the simple implementation
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Is the upfront cast in line 58 and 59 already ensuring that there is no null pointer sneaking into the IF scope?
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText:
Yes, null instanceof SomeClass always returns false.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2950319/is-null-check-needed-before-calling-instanceof
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: The super user should always be deactivated after each test. Why is it removed here?
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText: Also agree here, which is why I added the tearDown method to set the super user to false.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: Oh yes i see. it god added 🙈 .
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Should still be here to set the super user to false, after a test case has been executed.
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText:
I agree, which is why I added the super.tearDown().
Its not removed. Its added.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

Renamed AtomicException to AtomicExceptionReference - (Task #432)

- Recommended by spotbugs as to prevent confusion with actual Exceptions
(e.g. classes that subcass the Exception class).
